textContent:
Weapons may have an active effect. These are labelled as Weapon Skills. Warriors, Knights and Rogues have passives and abilities that interact with Weapon Skills (they increase damage, they have an extra effect, etc.)

Warrior passive T4: Flow of battle stacks up to 4 times only, but the damage of your heavy attack is not increased with momentum.

Make a Matrix of class combos. See if they make sense.

Knights obtain heavy armor as a T2 passive, to prevent multiclassing to get heavy armor.

Give random spells to multiple classes that don't apparently need it to be optimal. This may prove handy for multiclassing. Example: Priest spell that imbues your attacks with Light damage. Useless for most priests, but for a paladin type character it may prove invaluable

Warrior: T5 passive. Whenever you deal a Heavy Attack with a different type of Physical damage (Bludgeoning, Piercing and Slashing), you gain a unique buff. This stacks for different types of damage. This encourages weapon switching mid combat.
Warriors have different abilities for different types of weapons (slashing, piercing, Bludgeoning)


When designing abilities for a class, determine how many abilities go into these categories.l (defense, offense, CC...)
Priests might be utility and defense for others heavy, but low on mobility. Knights might excel in defense and be good in CC, defense for others, etc.
Find weaknesses and strengths for each class
